sourcesContent:
import Collapsible from "../../Collapsible"; const ListPage = () => { return (

Chest Pain

Any part of your chest can hurt when you have chest pain. The pain may spread to other parts of your body, including your arms or neck.

What can be the causes of chest pain?
Chest pain can not only be caused by a heart attack or heart issues but also by other serious diseases. Such as:

Pericarditis
Pericarditis is the inflammation of a protective sac-like structure called the pericardium that locates around the heart. Chest pain can be a common symptom of Pericarditis, and the pain is caused by the friction between different layers of the pericardium, or between the layers and the heart.

Aortic aneurysm
The aortic aneurysm is a bulge that occurs in the aorta, which is the human body's main artery. According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, it was responsible for 9,904 deaths in 2019. The bulge can grow larger with pressure from the bloodstream and may rupture, causing sudden and severe pain in the chest if patients do not receive timely treatment.

Aorta tear
When an aorta tear occurs, blood flows between the layers of the aortic wall will cause them separate. With the separation, it may cause serious pain and it usually happens without any indication. The pain usually occurs in the chest or upper back.

Esophageal spasms
Esophageal spasms are abnormal contractions of the esophageal muscles that can result in significant chest discomfort, tightness, or a squeezing feeling in the chest. The main cause for it is still unclear. However, hot or cold food, stress, anxiety, or exercise can exacerbate the pain.

Esophagitis
The inflammation of the esophagus is called the esophagitis. Esophagitis can irritate the lining of the esophagus and cause a burning feeling in the chest.

Gallstones
Gallstones are deposits of digestive fluid that are hardened and they are formed in the gallbladder. The location of the pain caused by gallstones can vary, and sometimes the pain can be spread to your chest.

Pulmonary embolism
A blood clot from other parts of the body may get stuck in the pulmonary artery of the lung, leading to difficulty in breathing and then causing chest pain.

Chest muscle Injuries
The tear in the chest muscle can cause chest pain and may also be accompanied by bruising and swelling in the surrounding area.

How to avoid the chest pain?

  • Enough warm-up before work-out to avoid unnecessary injuries
  • No access amount of intake of alcohol
  • A healthy diet, which means you need to have a proper amount of intake of nutrients
  • No overweight
  • Go to the hospital if you feel chest pain to avoid further disease
  • Avoid smoking

cite from Link 1 Link 2

Hemoptysis

Spitting blood that comes from the lungs or bronchial tubes is known as hemoptysis.

Causes of hemoptysis:

Infection
Infection is the most common cause of hemoptysis, which is responsible for 60-70% of the total cases (American Family Physician). The infection will lead to inflammation and then leads to the rupture of the blood vessels and finally lead to hemoptysis.

Bronchiectasis
When the bronchial tubes are infected, it may cause continuous dilation, leading to the airway block. If the bronchial tube wall is damaged, it may cause capillaries to rupture, and then a change in the color of the sputum may occur during coughing. Drugs such as amoxicillin capsules can be taken orally for anti-inflammatory treatment. But it is important to go to the hospital for proper diagnosis and treatment.

Tuberculosis
Tuberculosis is a chronic infectious disease and it may affect various internal organs of the body. Patients may have the symptoms such as cough, phlegm, hemoptysis, chest pain, and other symptoms

Lung cancer
Tumor tissue affects the capillaries of the lungs, patients will have the symptoms such as cough, hemoptysis, shortness of breath, chest pain, fatigue, and unexplained weight loss.

Lung abscess

A lung abscess is a condition where the tissue in the lung undergoes liquefactive necrosis, leading to the formation of cavities (more than 2 cm) that contain necrotic debris or fluid caused by an infection of microorganisms. When abnormal lung tissues affect the blood capillaries, patients may have the symptoms of hemoptysis.

Nose disease
When the nose gets injured, the blood in the nose may flow into the pharynx and cause bloody sputum.

Cancer
According to the National Library of Medicine, about 20% of the patients with lung cancer in the US experience the symptoms of hemoptysis and it is usually a difficult problem to deal with. Meanwhile, about a quarter of all hemoptysis cases are caused by lung cancer. It is necessary for patients to go to the hospital when experiencing hemoptysis for a long time.

How to avoid hemoptysis?

  • Avoid smoking and the second-hand smoking
  • Drink the proper amount of water to avoid the respiratory tract dryness
  • Be careful with the drugs, some types of drugs may increase the risk of bleeding
  • Go to the hospital to have professional treatment to avoid the further development of the potentially serious disease.

cite from Link 1 Link 2 Link 3

Hemoptysis

The pain in the face or head area is known as the headache. Headache is divided into three parts: tension, migraine, and cluster. The types of headaches depend on the location and the severity of the pain. A tension headache has the feeling of pressure or tightness on the sides and back of the head, as well as across the forehead. sensitivity in the neck, shoulder, and scalp muscles. The pain is usually mild to moderate. Compared to a tension headache, a cluster or migraine headache brings more pain to the patients.

Causes of headache:

Stress
Stress is a complex reason to cause headaches that can result in headaches in several ways. The stress may make the body release certain types of hormones such as adrenaline and then make the muscle tense up and finally leading to a headache. Meanwhile, stress can sometimes make people skip meals, smoke or drink alcohol, and indirectly leads to headaches. Also, stress makes us more sensitive to pain and then exacerbates existing headaches.

Alcohol
When people drink an excessive amount of alcohol, it may cause blood to flow into the brain and trigger headaches.

chronic myeloid leukemia
The extra white cells may block the blood vessels in the brain and then leads to headache.

lymphoma
If the tumor grows and presses on the surrounding normal nerves, or causes increased intracranial pressure, headaches are very likely to happen.

leukemia
Most patients with leukemia have headaches are caused by leukemia anemia or caused by the spread of leukemia cells to the brain which then leads to blood vessel dilation. Anemia reduces the number of red blood cells in the body. Then, there is also a decrease in oxygen transport in the blood, which may lead to a lack of oxygen to the brain, causing headaches. The occurrence of headaches for leukemia patients may also be caused by leukemia cells spreading to the brain through the blood, causing the expansion of blood vessels in the brain.

multiple myeloma
In patients with multiple myeloma, excessive myeloma protein in the blood may cause increased blood viscosity which leads to slow blood flow and hypoxia. This condition can cause cardiovascular and cerebrovascular diseases, which, in turn, may lead to headaches.


Many other types of cancers can cause headaches because of the spread of cancer cells to the brain. It is necessary to go to the hospital for professional and further treatment to avoid the development of the disease.

cite from Link 1

Stomachache

Causes of Stomachache:

Gastroenteritis
Gastroenteritis is usually caused by bacterial, viral, or parasitic infections. In patients with gastroenteritis, the mucosal barrier in the gastrointestinal tract may be compromised. Eating can affect the secretion of gastric acid, pepsin, trypsin, and other digestive fluids, and digestive fluid can further damage the gastrointestinal mucosa, leading to stomachache.

Peptic ulcer disease
Ulcers cause damage to the mucous membrane of the digestive tract. After mucosal damage, strong acid stimulation may lead to stomachache.

Irritable bowel syndrome
People with irritable bowel syndrome contract their colon muscles more than the normal condition. The abnormal contractions cause pain and cramps. Additionally, IBS patients are more likely to have reduced pain tolerance.


Sometimes people think that when they do not wear enough clothes and feel cold, that may cause stomachache. However, it may actually be acute gastroenteritis or irritable bowel syndrome.

cite from Link 1

Red Eyes

Infections, allergies, autoimmune diseases, irritation, injuries, or damage to the eyes, eyelids, or surrounding tissues can cause red eyes.

Red eyes can also be a symptom of some severe disease:

Conjunctivitis
The most common cause of red eyes is conjunctivitis. Dilation of the capillaries in the conjunctiva can cause redness in the eyes. The causes of conjunctivitis can include bacterial, viral, or mycoplasma infections, as well as other factors. Treatment for red eyes depends on the cause.

scleritis
Scleritis is an inflammation of the sclera, which can cause redness, swelling, and pain. The redness in scleritis is caused by the congestion of the blood vessels in the sclera, which can lead to redness in the eye. Individuals with scleritis may experience red eyes as a result of this congestion.

keratitis
Keratitis can be a bacterial or viral infection that causes congestion in the conjunctiva and lead to red eyes.

glaucoma
Individuals with glaucoma may experience visual field defects and optic nerve damage. Glaucoma can lead to an increase in intraocular pressure, which can cause congestion in the conjunctiva and make the eye look red.


The treatment for red eyes typically involves the use of eye drops or ointments. While red eyes are a common symptom, it is important to seek professional medical treatment if individuals experience it for a long period of time. Red eyes can be effectively prevented by practicing good eye hygiene and avoiding eye strain in daily life.

cite from Link 1

Epistaxis

Epistaxis, also known as nosebleed, is caused by the rupture of blood vessels in the nasal cavity and surrounding tissues and is one of the common symptoms that can be caused by disease of the nose itself, or by disease elsewhere

Cause of Epistaxis:

High Blood Pressure
The blood vessels in the nasal cavity are relatively rich, and the blood vessel wall is relatively thin. When the blood pressure rises, the blood pressure on the blood vessels increases, resulting in bleeding caused by the rupture of the blood vessels in the nose. If it is caused by high blood pressure, after controlling nosebleeds, it is also important to control blood pressure. Individuals should maintain blood pressure at a normal and stable level, and prevent future nosebleeds.

Nasosinusitis
Nasosinusitis is the inflammation of the sinus mucosa caused by fungal, viral, or bacterial infections. Because the inflammation will stimulate the nasal cavity which will result in nasal cavity damage and cause nosebleeds. Each person's health condition is not the same, and the symptoms are different, so nosebleeds may not occur.

Leukemia
Patients with leukemia will be abnormal in hemopoiesis (the production of platelets and blood cells), which may lead to a decrease in making the platelets and then will result in abnormal coagulation function. Then the patients may have nosebleeds.

Fever

Fever is one type of response sent from the human's immune system and it is basically the temperature rise. In most cases, it is caused by the infection. However, sometimes it can be caused by some serious disease.

Pneumonia
Pneumonia mainly refers to a lung infection caused by bacteria, viruses, and other pathogens. The invasion of bacteria, viruses, and fungi can lead to a response from the immune system, resulting in fever symptoms. If pneumonia affects a large part of the body and involves multiple lobes, patients' lives may be in danger. If pneumonia is suspected, patients are suggested to go to the respiratory department of the hospital for further checks to avoid the development of the disease.

Tuberculosis
Tuberculosis is a chronic infectious disease caused by the bacterium tuberculosis. There may be no fever at the beginning of the disease, and when the disease develops further, it will cause abnormalities in white blood cells and red blood cells in the body, which will be accompanied by fever symptoms. Individuals who get tuberculosis and do not receive treatments have a death rate of 50%. Therefore, it is necessary to go to the hospital if tuberculosis is suspected.

Lung cancer
Fever of early lung cancer is usually caused by obstructive pneumonia due to necrosis of lung cancer tissue. If patients do not accept the effective treatment, a more serious infection of the lungs may occur and a high fever may occur.

Covid-19
Covid-19 will cause a fever since after infection, the immune system will be stimulated and respond to the virus. If the body temperature is lower than 38.5 C, patients can put ice on the forehead and use fever cooling patches to help cool down. If the fever temperature is higher than 38.5, it is necessary to take the medicines and go to the hospital.

Fever

Sneezing is a normal protective reaction of the nose. When people are stimulated by dust, pollen, and cold air, a strong airflow will be generated, and expel the irritants through the nerve reflex. Sneezing is a common symptom in daily life and it is also an important part of the immune system response to keep us healthy. It cannot only be caused by the cold but also by other diseases.

Allergic rhinitis
Allergic rhinitis sneezing is mainly caused by allergic patients when the nasal mucosa is affected by allergens in the air such as dust or pollen, once these allergens enter the nasal cavity, it will result in rapid allergic reactions in the nasal cavity of patients, and finally cause the sneezing. Individuals can do more exercise and build up resistance to irritants. Also, people can try to avoid irritants including pollen, cold air, smoking, perfume, mosquito, and other odor stimulation. Wearing masks can attenuate symptoms.

Nasosinusitis
It is a disease with a high incidence rate and affects the quality of life. Symptoms usually include respiratory infections, nasal congestion, runny nose, sneezing, and headaches. In order to treat nasosinusitis, patients usually need to go to the hospital to get some medicines, or sometimes surgeries can also be used to treat nasosinusitis.

Measles
Measles is caused by infection with the measles virus, which is spread by droplets and close contact. Typical measles initially start with severe symptoms such as high fever, red eyes, sneezing, and measles mucous spots, followed by a brown-red maculopapular rash a few days later. Currently, there is no specific treatment for measles. However, people can use the following treatment to attenuate symptoms.

  • Drink plenty of water
  • pay attention to skin and eye, nose and mouth cleanliness
  • Follow the doctor's advice and take medicines according to the symptoms


Sneezing is usually related to infectious diseases and normally it is not caused by severe disease. However, when the life quality is greatly affected by sneezing, it is necessary to go to the hospital.

cite from Link 1 Link 2
